result.execSummary:
The defendant Marvtavis Walter Pugh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $1000.00 to Anita G.
DNA surcharges waived due assessment of DNA surcharge on 15CF2276.
Court waived all costs due to imposition of restitution imposed on this case and on case 15CF2276, and due to imposition of court costs on 15CF2276.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter.
The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to 15CF1374.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full-time employment. Obtain a GED/HSED.

No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.

Cooperate with the Probation Department.
Court waived DNA sample due to DNA sample order on 15CF2276.
Court orders no other specific programming conditions. Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with 0 days credit CONCURRENT with Count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marvtavis Walter Pugh

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Martavis Walter Pugh in court with attorney Scott Douglas Connors.  Defendant Martavis Walter Pugh in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  State has satisfied victim notification.   PSI reviewed and corrections made.  
On Court's motion defendant's first name is amended to Marvtavis and defendant's correct date of birth is 01-16-1997.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
As to Count 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3 YEARS with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to 15CF1374; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1.5 YEARS.
As to Count 2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3 YEARS with 0 days credit CONCURRENT with Count 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1.5 YEARS.
Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.

  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- Absolute sobriety
- No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs
- Random urine screens
- Seek and maintain full-time employment
- Obtain a GED/HSED
- Court waived DNA sample due to DNA sample order on 15CF2276
- Court orders no other specific programming conditions. Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $1000.00 to Anita G
DNA surcharges waived due assessment of DNA surcharge on 15CF2276
Court waived all costs due to imposition of restitution imposed on this case and on case 15CF2276, and due to imposition of court costs on 15CF2276
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Victim Impact Statements
Sentencing hearing scheduled for 11-05-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Martavis Walter Pugh in court with Attorney Scott Douglas Connors.  Defendant Martavis Walter Pugh in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has three cases before the court.

As to Count 1 and Count 2:
Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Court orders a presentence investigation.  Order received and filed.  Court orders defendant remanded into the custody of the sheriff pending sentencing.
Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Scott Douglas Connors in court, defendant Martavis Walter Pugh not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea hearing,however defense has retained new counsel.  Atty Connors requests more time.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices in court, defendant Martavis Walter Pugh not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter for Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea hearing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Martavis Walter Pugh in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Defendant Martavis Walter Pugh in custody.  Michael Lonskis for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  At the request of the District Attorney, and without objection by the Court or defense, case is returned to Branch 22.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Martavis Walter Pugh in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Defendant Martavis Walter Pugh in custody.  Ronald Dague on behalf of Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Due to lower pending case, defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defense Counsel Phillips is requesting an adjournment, as he will be out of town and not available on the previously scheduled Preliminary Hearing date of April 17, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.  ADA Anderson has no objection to an adjournment.  Stipulation to an adjournment is agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.  Case is adjourned to April 20, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.  Court has been informed by the State that Defense Counsel will submit a waiver.  Date of April 17, 2015 is vacated.  Preliminary Hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 8:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Martavis Walter Pugh in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Martavis Walter Pugh in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
